title: Greek: Multiple injuries caused by train collision
description: Authorities in northern Greece say they are responding to reports of multiple injuries caused by a train collision

title: Robert Hébras, last survivor of infamous massacre in France, dies at 97
description: He served as a memory keeper for the martyred town of Oradour-sur-Glane, where Nazis killed 642 villagers in the course of a day during World War II.

title: Emboldened by Israel’s far right, Jewish settlers fan the flames of chaos
description: Violent vigilante settlers are resurfacing in the occupied West Bank, just as a cycle of attacks have brought the region to the brink of another all-out conflict.

title: Governments around the world have moved to ban or restrict TikTok, amid security fears
description: Canada implemented a ban on TikTok across government-issued phones Tuesday, joining a list of governments that have moved to reign in or bar the platform.

title: UN says at least 50,000 killed in Turkey and Syria quakes
description: The devastating earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria have killed at least 50,000 people with many more injured, tens of thousands still missing and hundreds of thousands homeless

title: Thousands stranded as Colombia's Viva Air grounds flights
description: Struggling low-cost airline Viva Air has suspended its operations in Colombia and Peru

title: Mexican president: Mexico has more democracy than US
description: Mexico’s president says his country is more democratic than the United States

title: Russian authorities on alert after flurry of drone sightings
description: Putin ordered tightened border security and officials briefly halted flights in St. Petersburg after governors across western Russia reported attempted drone attacks.

title: Prestigious Dan David Prize names 9 historians as winners
description: Nine emerging scholars of history from around the world have been announced as winners of the prestigious Dan David Prize, with each awardee receiving $300,000 to help further their work

title: Hundreds massacred in Ethiopia even as peace deal was being reached
description: Soldiers from neighboring Eritrea went house to house killing villagers in Ethiopia’s Tigray region, witnesses say.

title: U.S. Climate envoy Kerry meeting authorities in Brazil
description: The U.S. special climate envoy John Kerry on Tuesday was holding his second day of meetings with Brazilian government officials, executives and lawmakers to discuss details of planned environmental actions

title: Doctors: Security forces kill protester near Sudan's capital
description: A medical group says Sudanese security forces shot and killed an anti-government protester near the capital Khartoum

title: US endorses EU plan to ease Serbia-Kosovo tensions
description: A senior U.S. official says Washington has high expectations for a European Union-sponsored plan aimed at easing long-standing tensions between Serbia and Kosovo

title: Police find 850 kilos of cocaine washed up on French beach
description: French maritime police have found nearly a ton of cocaine on a beach on the English Channel this week

title: Somalia drought 'extremely critical' but no famine projected
description: Food security experts say life remains “extremely critical” for more than 6 million hungry people in Somalia’s historic drought, but they no longer project famine for the worst-hit population of nearly a quarter-million people between April and June

title: Asteroid named after pope behind Gregorian calendar reform
description: The 16th century pope responsible for what is today known as the Gregorian calendar now has another, celestial claim to fame

title: Doctor: Hospital in disputed Somaliland city shelled, 1 dead
description: A doctor says the main hospital in a disputed city in the Somaliland region has been shelled and at least one person has died during an upsurge of violence

title: Tensions rise in Nigeria as opposition demands new vote
description: Nigeria’s opposition demanded a revote Tuesday for the country’s presidential election, where partial results show an early lead for the ruling party

title: Moroccan jailed for beheading European hikers kills himself
description: Authorities say a Moroccan from an Islamic State-affiliated ring who was sentenced to death for the beheadings of two Scandinavian tourists has killed himself in prison

title: Ugandan, South African leaders urge greater trade in Africa
description: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni has called for stronger trade relations among African countries and lamented the high cost of buying products and services outside the continent

title: Snow blankets Mallorca, Spanish holiday island best known for sun year-round
description: Storm Juliette brought freezing Arctic temperatures, snow and wind to the Mediterranean island.

title: Mexican president says Tesla to build plant in Mexico
description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said Tuesday that electric car company Tesla has committed to building a plant in the city of Monterrey, an industrial hub in northern Mexico

title: Mexico’s president claimed he had photo proof of a mystical elf. Why?
description: Andrés Manuel López Obrador tweeted a photo he said showed an "aluxe," a Mayan elflike creature, in what one analyst called one of his "most bizarre" interventions.

title: Activists call on Trinidad to repatriate citizens in Syria
description: Human Rights Watch is calling on the government of Trinidad & Tobago to repatriate more than 90 of its citizens detained as Islamic State suspects and family members in war-torn Syria

title: Canada is latest country to ban TikTok on government phones
description: Canada's government said it had reviewed the Chinese-owned video-sharing app and “determined that it presents an unacceptable level of risk to privacy and security.”

title: Puerto Rico to close lone zoo after years of complaints
description: Puerto Rico’s government is closing the U.S. territory’s only zoo following years of suspected negligence, a lack of resources and deaths of animals that were highlighted by activists

title: Alleged higher Iran enrichment worries Germany, Israel
description: Germany’s foreign minister says her country and Israel are worried about an accusation attributed to international inspectors that Iran enriched uranium to 84% purity

title: Poor U.S. planning in Afghanistan helped Taliban take over, watchdog says
description: Years of poor oversight, a U.S.-Taliban accord in 2020 and an "abrupt" U.S. military withdrawal contributed to the rapid fall of Kabul to the Taliban, a special inspector general's report says.

title: Brazil delegation visits Amazon region where pair died
description: A delegation from the Brazilian government that includes widows of two slain men who had worked for justice for Indigenous Amazon peoples arrived in the remote region where the two were slain Monday in a symbolic retake of the place, now that a new government has taken office in Brazil

title: Ugandan lawmaker introduces new anti-LGBTQ legislation
description: A Ugandan lawmaker on Tuesday introduced draft legislation that he said seeks to prohibit homosexuality in the East African country, voicing widespread anti-gay sentiment that has peaked in recent days

title: Flurry of drone strikes hits Russia as TV, radio are hacked
description: Regional officials in southern and western Russia are reporting a string of drone attacks near the border with Ukraine and deep inside the country

title: Protesters to Norway's energy minister: you talk 'nonsense'
description: Norway’s energy minister has met with activists who are now blocking the entrance to several ministries in Oslo to protest a wind farm they say hinders the rights of the Sami Indigenous people to raise reindeer in Arctic Norway

title: UK police search for infant after missing couple arrested
description: British police have launched a major search for a two-month-old baby after officers arrested the infant’s mother and her boyfriend who had been missing since January

title: GOP-led House steps up scrutiny of Biden’s military aid for Ukraine
description: Senior Pentagon officials closely involved with the administration’s Ukraine security assistance program are due to appear at two House hearings Tuesday.

title: China says it's been 'open and transparent' on COVID origins
description: China says it has been “open and transparent” in the search for the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic and dismissed U.S. criticism as politicizing the issue

title: French court to rule on TotalEnergies' east Africa projects
description: A Paris court is set to rule on a case pitting French and Ugandan environmentalist groups against oil giant TotalEnergies regarding a major oil field and pipeline projects in east Africa

title: Israel says motorist killed in West Bank held US citizenship
description: Israeli authorities says the motorist killed by a suspected Palestinian gunman in the occupied West Bank held citizenship in both the United States and Israel

title: German ‘babysitter’ convicted in major child sex abuse case
description: A 45-year-old German man who had offered babysitting services online has been convicted of sexually abusing children

title: China says will train foreign astronauts for space station
description: China says it will soon begin training foreign astronauts for trips to its newly completed orbiting space station

title: Suspected schoolgirl poisoning attacks rattle a shaken Iran
description: For months, hundreds of young girls attending different schools in Iran have become overpowered by what are believed to be noxious fumes wafting into their classrooms, with some ending up weakened on hospital beds

title: China, saying it can mediate on Ukraine, hosts Putin’s ally Lukashenko
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko arrives in Beijing on Tuesday, part of an effort by countries like Russia, China and Iran to show unity.

title: Governments shut down the internet more often than ever, report says
description: Authorities in 35 countries instituted internet shutdowns at least 187 times in 2022, according to rights group Access Now, with India doing so the most.

title: Protestant Council of Rwanda bars abortions in its clinics
description: The Protestant Council of Rwanda has directed all health facilities run by its members to stop carrying out all abortions, further limiting access to the procedure in the largely Christian nation of 13 million people

title: Taliban: 2 senior IS members killed in Afghanistan
description: Two senior regional members of the Islamic State group have been killed in Afghanistan in recent weeks during separate raids in Kabul

title: Airline to suspend Moldova flights after Russian missile crossed airspace
description: Hungary's Wizz Air will stop flights at Chisinau airport in March. This month, a Russian missile aimed at Ukraine flew over Moldova and near Romania.

title: Israeli PM's ultranationalist ally quits as deputy minister
description: An ultranationalist ally of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has tendered his resignation as a deputy minister in the new government

title: Taiwan needs more Top Guns as chance of conflict with China grows
description: Taiwan is facing a shortage of fighter pilots as a result of falling birth rates, the declining appeal of the military and the increasing threat from China.

title: Ukraine live briefing: War to dominate G-20 discussions; Belarusian leader to visit China
description: The war in Ukraine is likely to loom over discussions at a meeting of Group of 20 foreign ministers in India this week, as China hosts Kremlin ally Alexander Lukashenko.

title: Police look for evidence for slain Hong Kong model’s case
description: Hong Kong police are searching a landfill for evidence related to the killing of a model

title: Israel’s far-right government is at the heart of a surge in violence
description: Talk of a “cycle of violence” between Israelis and Palestinians obscures how the provocative agenda of Israel’s far right may be fanning the flames.
